com.sac.speech

Class Speech

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.sac.speech.Speech

  • public class Speech
extends java.lang.Object
    Helper class to easily work with Android speech recognition.

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public static Speech init(android.content.Context context)
        Initializes speech recognition.
        Parameters:
        context - application context
        Returns:
        speech instance

      • init

        public static Speech init(android.content.Context context,
                          java.lang.String callingPackage)
        Initializes speech recognition.
        Parameters:
        context - application context
        callingPackage - The extra key used in an intent to the speech recognizer for voice search. Not generally to be used by developers. The system search dialog uses this, for example, to set a calling package for identification by a voice search API. If this extra is set by anyone but the system process, it should be overridden by the voice search implementation. By passing null or empty string (which is the default) you are not overriding the calling package
        Returns:
        speech instance

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
        Must be called inside Activity's onDestroy.

      • getInstance

        public static Speech getInstance()
        Gets speech recognition instance.
        Returns:
        SpeechRecognition instance

      • startListening

        public void startListening(SpeechDelegate delegate)
                    throws SpeechRecognitionNotAvailable,
                           GoogleVoiceTypingDisabledException
        Starts voice recognition.
        Parameters:
        delegate - delegate which will receive speech recognition events and status
        Throws:
        SpeechRecognitionNotAvailable - when speech recognition is not available on the device
        GoogleVoiceTypingDisabledException - when google voice typing is disabled on the device

      • startListening

        public void startListening(SpeechProgressView progressView,
                           SpeechDelegate delegate)
                    throws SpeechRecognitionNotAvailable,
                           GoogleVoiceTypingDisabledException
        Starts voice recognition.
        Parameters:
        progressView - view in which to draw speech animation
        delegate - delegate which will receive speech recognition events and status
        Throws:
        SpeechRecognitionNotAvailable - when speech recognition is not available on the device
        GoogleVoiceTypingDisabledException - when google voice typing is disabled on the device

      • stopListening

        public void stopListening()
        Stops voice recognition listening. This method does nothing if voice listening is not active

      • isListening

        public boolean isListening()
        Check if voice recognition is currently active.
        Returns:
        true if the voice recognition is on, false otherwise

      • say

        public void say(java.lang.String message)
        Uses text to speech to transform a written message into a sound.
        Parameters:
        message - message to play

      • say

        public void say(java.lang.String message,
                TextToSpeechCallback callback)
        Uses text to speech to transform a written message into a sound.
        Parameters:
        message - message to play
        callback - callback which will receive progress status of the operation

      • stopTextToSpeech

        public void stopTextToSpeech()
        Stops text to speech.

      • setPreferOffline

        public Speech setPreferOffline(boolean preferOffline)
        Set whether to only use an offline speech recognition engine. The default is false, meaning that either network or offline recognition engines may be used.
        Parameters:
        preferOffline - true to prefer offline engine, false to use either one of the two
        Returns:
        speech instance

      • setGetPartialResults

        public Speech setGetPartialResults(boolean getPartialResults)
        Set whether partial results should be returned by the recognizer as the user speaks (default is true). The server may ignore a request for partial results in some or all cases.
        Parameters:
        getPartialResults - true to get also partial recognition results, false otherwise
        Returns:
        speech instance

      • setLocale

        public Speech setLocale(java.util.Locale locale)
        Sets text to speech and recognition language. Defaults to device language setting.
        Parameters:
        locale - new locale
        Returns:
        speech instance

      • setTextToSpeechRate

        public Speech setTextToSpeechRate(float rate)
        Sets the speech rate. This has no effect on any pre-recorded speech.
        Parameters:
        rate - Speech rate. 1.0 is the normal speech rate, lower values slow down the speech (0.5 is half the normal speech rate), greater values accelerate it (2.0 is twice the normal speech rate).
        Returns:
        speech instance

      • setTextToSpeechPitch

        public Speech setTextToSpeechPitch(float pitch)
        Sets the speech pitch for the TextToSpeech engine. This has no effect on any pre-recorded speech.
        Parameters:
        pitch - Speech pitch. 1.0 is the normal pitch, lower values lower the tone of the synthesized voice, greater values increase it.
        Returns:
        speech instance

      • setStopListeningAfterInactivity

        public Speech setStopListeningAfterInactivity(long milliseconds)
        Sets the idle timeout after which the listening will be automatically stopped.
        Parameters:
        milliseconds - timeout in milliseconds
        Returns:
        speech instance

      • setTransitionMinimumDelay

        public Speech setTransitionMinimumDelay(long milliseconds)
        Sets the minimum interval between start/stop events. This is useful to prevent monkey input from users.
        Parameters:
        milliseconds - minimum interval betweeb state change in milliseconds
        Returns:
        speech instance

      • setTextToSpeechQueueMode

        public Speech setTextToSpeechQueueMode(int mode)
        Sets the text to speech queue mode. By default is TextToSpeech.QUEUE_FLUSH, which is faster, because it clears all the messages before speaking the new one. TextToSpeech.QUEUE_ADD adds the last message to speak in the queue, without clearing the messages that have been added.
        Parameters:
        mode - It can be either TextToSpeech.QUEUE_ADD or TextToSpeech.QUEUE_FLUSH.
        Returns:
        speech instance

      • setListener

        public void setListener(Speech.stopDueToDelay listener)
